arts.ttl: Serie A | Torino 2-0 Cagliari: Match Report
arts.sum: In a thrilling Serie A match at the Stadio Olimpico Grande Torino, Che Adams scored a spectacular brace to guide Torino to a much-needed 2-0 win against Cagliari. The victory ends Torino's streak of four consecutive draws and provides a significant boost to their season. The post Serie A | Torino 2-0 Cagliari: Match Report appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Torino vs. Cagliari to kick off matchday 22
arts.sum: Torino have drawn each of their last four matches in Serie A and they could be the first team to draw five games in a row in this Serie A season; in addition, they could equal their record of consecutive draws in the top-flight in the three points for a win era, as they achieved in 2020-21 and 2008-09. The Lithuanian could become the first Torino player to score in two consecutive matches before turning 21 in the era of three points for a win in the top-flight.

arts.ttl: Serie A | Torino v Cagliari: Probable starting lineups
arts.sum: Torino faces several lineup challenges as they prepare for their upcoming match against Cagliari this evening. Ali Dembele will be absent due to suspension following his red card in the recent draw against Fiorentina. However, the team will welcome back Karol Linetty and Sebastian Walukiewicz, who have completed their suspensions. The post Serie A | Torino v Cagliari: Probable starting lineups appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Cagliari Manager Nicola Defends Mina: “He’s No Provocateur”
arts.sum: In a press conference ahead of Cagliari's match against Torino, manager Davide Nicola addressed the recent controversies surrounding defender Yerry Mina. The Colombian player has been at the centre of debates due to his alleged provocative behaviour, which some claim led to the red cards of D'Ambrosio against Monza and Rebic against Lecce. Nicola, however, firmly rejected these accusations. The post Cagliari Manager Nicola Defends Mina: “He’s No Provocateur” appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Torino’s Vanoli Focused on Cagliari Match Amid Transfer Talk
arts.sum: As Torino prepare to face Cagliari in the 22nd round of Serie A, manager Paolo Vanoli addressed the media, emphasizing the importance of the upcoming match and deflecting questions about potential transfers.
